div.p: [...] which is the 14th day of this month, when most of the lords of the Rhaetians and the delegates have now arrived for the assembly and the fair: "The people of Ferrara, along with the Pope and many other princes and cardinals... are sending a huge amount of money (some call it gold) and soldiers to the king.
All citizens are armed and on an expedition.

One from Ortenstein confirms with certain evidence that the black riders have laid some banners... It is said that someone, who had a hand cut off, received a hole in the head and was lying under Wilhelm Travers.

Dr. Brunner from St. Gallen writes to Mr. Pontisella and me, asking us to find another place for him to stay; for he has received no response from the people of Maienfeld. But now there is nothing available except some filial places in the Val Raccolta, which, however, are infected with the plague.
